text: I'm very excited for tomorrow's PS5 event. Just shower me with awesome trailers, gameplay showcases and game reveals. The one I'm most excited about is a potential Silent Hill reboot by members of the original team (including Yamaoka of course), that alone would make my day. Let's try to do some predictions: Silent Hill reboot, Demon's Souls Remastered, Resident Evil 8 reveal, Final Fantasy XVI teaser, new Ubisoft game reveal (Splinter Cell?), new Ratchet & Clank, Horizon Zero Dawn sequel, new Gran Turismo, and the final PS5 design won't be revealed.
author: SupraDarky

text: THIS is the song I would always listen to first when I got into work for like two months of last year! One of those extended versions of Silent Hill OST that came up in my recommended once and never left. There's something so eerily soothing about those chords; they paint an atmosphere like no other music.

author: agthaog1986

text: agthaog1986 - I mostly agree with you. The first three Silent Hill games are all masterpieces, and the fourth one was also good from what I heard. I just have never played it myself. But in the case of video games, the second game in a franchise tends to be one of the best/most loved and better than the first. Like Crash Bandicoot, Spyro, Syphon Filter, Silent Hill, Jak and Daxter, Uncharted, Sonic, Sonic Adventure, Skate, and a bunch of others. It‚Äôs not always the case tho.
author: JFKTV

text: @JFKTV yeah i heard good things about 4 as well. your absolutely right the 2nd usually is the best traditionally.  I think what i was tryna say is (really in entertainment overall) that since the 90s or so i feel that "part 2's" haven't been as great. expecially after like mid 2000's id say...like u said syphon,spyro, crash....man those were the good old days.
author: agthaog1986

text: agthaog1986 - I‚Äôd love to go back to the 90s and early 2000s to experience everything fresh again. That was an amazing time to be alive, man.
